Name: Board of Directors' Report and Financial Statements Sustainability statement | Decision-making process and internal control procedures | F-Secure has established an ESG Council containing members from F-Secure’s | Leadership Team (CPO, CFO, SVP Corporate Development) and key stakeholders | from various functions to drive the ESG agenda at F-Secure as described under | The ESG Council is responsible for regularly re-assessing our DMA, as well as | our impacts, risks and opportunities. F-Secure’s ESG function under Corporate | Development develops required internal controls in collaboration with the topic | owner and updates of new controls will be presented to the ESG Council and | Director of Financial Controlling who is the owner of the company-wide internal | controls procedure. The ESG Council will be informed if the control has failed and | present risk mitigation actions. Depending on the nature of the control, the Audit | Committee will also be informed about the status and further mitigation actions | being taken. | Integration of managing IROs and the risk management process | Assessment finalization. This includes further stakeholder engagement, sub-sub | F-Secure has implemented a process of continuous risk management in its | operations and functions. Each function will monthly or at minimum quarterly, | review the risks, the related progress of mitigation plans while the Leadership | Team reviews risks bi-annually. Each Leadership Team member (function lead) is | accountable for executing the risk management process in their functions. | The input parameters include stakeholder feedback, F-Secure’s own insights and | estimations for each threshold value. The estimations are made based on the best | available information at the time. | Board of Directors' Report and Financial Statements Sustainability statement | Topic | Strategy | Impact, risk and opportunity management | Environment | Climate change | Social | Own workforce | Consumers and end-users | Board of Directors' Report and Financial Statements Sustainability statement | Topic | Consumers and end-users | Governance | Business conduct
Description: 61 61 | Our Risk Management Policy explicitly requires evaluating the short-, mid- and 61 61 | long-term time horizons taking into consideration the severity of the impact (scale, 61 61 | scope, remendability) and probability for any ESG-related risks including actual and 61 61 | potential negative impacts, and in the case of a potential negative human rights 61 61 | The coordination of the DMA process and keeping our DMA up-to-date and relevant 61 61 | bi-annually is handled through F-Secure’s ESG Council. Any actual or potential 61 61 | negative impacts or risks found during the assessment would be assigned and 61 61 | owned by each respective function to mitigate the risk or negative impact as part 61 61 | of our risk management process, while actual or potential positive impacts, as well 61 61 | as opportunities are integrated as part of F-Secure’s strategy and relevant function 61 61 | execution plans. 61 61 | While 2024 is the first reporting period applying ESRS, DMA and lead 61 61 | reporting structure, the assessment process related to ESG impacts, risks and 61 61 | opportunities has been further developed as part of the F-Secure Double Materiality 61 61 | topic analysis and formally assigning specific impacts, risks and opportunities to 61 61 | specific functions. Possible future revisions of our DMA are subject to our annual 61 61 | DMA review by the ESG Council and as per our risk management process. Our next 61 61 | planned DMA review will take place no later than Q2/2025. 61 61 | F-Secure has included the following disclosure requirements in our sustainability 61 61 | statement as outlined in
